page.title: 15VILLAGE HISTORY
page.content: The earliest historical records of the existence of Ireby is in the Pipe Roll of 1185 spelt YREBI. The spelling changed through the years but would appear to be of Norse origin, meaning "the farmstead of the Irish man"- Byr meaning farmstead and YRR or IRA meaning Irish. For many years the village has been divided into the two manors of High and Low Ireby. Low Ireby, the larger part of the present village, was originally a clearing in the forest of Westward. Ireby's history as a market dates back many centuries to the year 1237. The market cross standing opposite the school gate was erected in 1275. Thursday was Ireby market day and a Fair lasting 3 days was held twice a year on Feb.24th and Sept.21st. In 1578 the success of Ireby market was threatening to impoverish Cockermouth's rival market.
